meanings.definition: To take away from the worth or value of something.
meanings.sent1: Talking loudly in the library can detract from others' focus.
meanings.sent2: Using poor quality materials can detract from the durability of the building.
meanings.sent3: Eating the last cookie may detract from your sister's happiness.
meanings.sent4: His absence seemed to detract from the warmth of the family gathering.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds detract from the beauty of the sunset.

meanings.definition: To reduce or diminish the quality or reputation of something.
meanings.sent1: Adding too much salt can detract from the flavor of the dish.
meanings.sent2: A single mistake should not detract from all your hard work.
meanings.sent3: Wearing mismatched socks might detract from your fashion statement.
meanings.sent4: The graffiti on the wall detracts from the elegance of the building.
meanings.sent5: The noisy construction work detracts from the peaceful atmosphere of the park.
